channel.title: News : NPR
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2023 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Share your story: Have you used medication for abortion or miscarriage care?
item.description: NPR would like to hear from you. With the future of some abortion pills in jeopardy, tell us about your experience using medication to end a pregnancy or treat a miscarriage.
item.content:encoded:
NPR would like to hear from you. With the future of some abortion pills in jeopardy, tell us about your experience using medication to end a pregnancy or treat a miscarriage.

(Image credit: Erin Hooley/Chicago Tribune/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Editors

item.title: Biden moves to expand DACA recipients' access to government-funded health insurance
item.description: The Department of Health and Human Services will propose an amended definition of "lawful presence" to include recipients of the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals program, the White House said.
item.content:encoded:
The Department of Health and Human Services will propose an amended definition of "lawful presence" to include recipients of the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals program, the White House said.

(Image credit: Saul Loeb/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Kaitlyn Radde

item.title: Air National Guardsman arrested as suspected leaker of Pentagon documents
item.description: The FBI has arrested a member of the Massachusetts Air National Guard, Jack Teixeira, as a suspect in the leak of classified intelligence documents.
item.content:encoded:
The FBI has arrested a member of the Massachusetts Air National Guard, Jack Teixeira, as a suspect in the leak of classified intelligence documents.

(Image credit: Patrick Semansky/AP)
item.dc:creator: Washington Desk

item.title: Will Fox News pay for spreading lies about voter fraud?
item.description: New York Times journalist Jeremy Peters explains Dominion Voting Systems' $1.6 billion lawsuit against the network. "Legal experts tell me that rarely have they seen a case this strong," he says.
item.content:encoded: New York Times journalist Jeremy Peters explains Dominion Voting Systems' $1.6 billion lawsuit against the network. "Legal experts tell me that rarely have they seen a case this strong," he says.
item.dc:creator: Terry Gross

item.title: Police make an arrest in San Francisco death of tech executive Bob Lee, official says
item.description: A San Francisco supervisor says an arrest was made early Thursday in the downtown stabbing death of the Cash App founder.
item.content:encoded:
A San Francisco supervisor says an arrest was made early Thursday in the downtown stabbing death of the Cash App founder.

(Image credit: Jeff Chiu/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Justice Department will ask the Supreme Court to restore full access to abortion pill
item.description: The Justice Department is seeking emergency relief from the U.S. Supreme Court in a Texas case involving limited access to the abortion drug mifepristone.
item.content:encoded:
The Justice Department is seeking emergency relief from the U.S. Supreme Court in a Texas case involving limited access to the abortion drug mifepristone.

(Image credit: Erin Hooley/Chicago Tribune/Tribune News Service via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Sarah McCammon

item.title: Women are earning more money. But they're still picking up a heavier load at home
item.description: A new Pew Research Center report finds that in opposite-sex marriages in the U.S., women's financial contributions have grown, but they're still doing a larger share of housework and caregiving.
item.content:encoded:
A new Pew Research Center report finds that in opposite-sex marriages in the U.S., women's financial contributions have grown, but they're still doing a larger share of housework and caregiving.

(Image credit: George Marks/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu

item.title: 'Harry Potter' books will be adapted into a decade-long TV series
item.description: Each season will be based on one book in the beloved series by controversial author J.K. Rowling, and the cast will be different from the films. Some fans are unhappy about Rowling's involvement.
item.content:encoded:
Each season will be based on one book in the beloved series by controversial author J.K. Rowling, and the cast will be different from the films. Some fans are unhappy about Rowling's involvement.

(Image credit: Ken Kinzie/Universal Orlando Resort via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Kaitlyn Radde

item.title: Mary Quant, fashion designer who styled the Swinging Sixties, dies at 93
item.description: Quant made playful clothes for young modern women they could wear to work and "run to the bus in." Her London shop was an epicenter of youth culture that popularized hot pants and miniskirts.
item.content:encoded:
Quant made playful clothes for young modern women they could wear to work and "run to the bus in." Her London shop was an epicenter of youth culture that popularized hot pants and miniskirts.

(Image credit: Ronald Dumont/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Neda Ulaby

item.title: A rare fireball flew over Maine. Now there's a $25K reward for pieces of space rock
item.description: The Maine Mineral and Gem Museum is looking for meteorites from a rare fireball event near the Maine-Canada border. It's willing to pay anyone who can find them.
item.content:encoded:
The Maine Mineral and Gem Museum is looking for meteorites from a rare fireball event near the Maine-Canada border. It's willing to pay anyone who can find them.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Feinstein asks to be temporarily replaced on Judiciary Committee amid calls to resign
item.description: The move could help Senate Democrats advance more federal judges for confirmation. Feinstein, the oldest member of Congress, hasn't cast a vote since Feb. 16.
item.content:encoded:
The move could help Senate Democrats advance more federal judges for confirmation. Feinstein, the oldest member of Congress, hasn't cast a vote since Feb. 16.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: A lost dog treks 150 miles across Alaskan sea ice before he's reunited with his family
item.description: Nanuq, a 1-year-old Australian shepherd, went missing last month while his family was visiting relatives. Except for a swollen leg, with bite marks from a seal or polar bear, Nanuq was in good health.
item.content:encoded:
Nanuq, a 1-year-old Australian shepherd, went missing last month while his family was visiting relatives. Except for a swollen leg, with bite marks from a seal or polar bear, Nanuq was in good health.

(Image credit: Mandy Iworrigan via AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Jailed Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny is ill, perhaps poisoned, an aide says
item.description: The 46-year-old Navalny fell ill last Friday when he was moved to a conventional cell and had lost about 18 pounds in 15 days. A spokeswoman says it's believed he's being given low doses of poison.
item.content:encoded:
The 46-year-old Navalny fell ill last Friday when he was moved to a conventional cell and had lost about 18 pounds in 15 days. A spokeswoman says it's believed he's being given low doses of poison.

(Image credit: Alexander Zemlianichenko/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Goodbye fuzzy donut: The famous first black hole photo gets sharpened up
item.description: Scientists have created a new version of a historic black hole image that was first unveiled back in 2019. The central black nothingness now looks larger and darker.
item.content:encoded:
Scientists have created a new version of a historic black hole image that was first unveiled back in 2019. The central black nothingness now looks larger and darker.

(Image credit: Medeiros et al 2023)
item.dc:creator: Nell Greenfieldboyce

item.title: There will be no federal charges in Shanquella Robinson's death, the DOJ says
item.description: Shanquella Robinson, 25, of Charlotte, N.C., was killed last October while vacationing in Mexico with friends.
item.content:encoded: Shanquella Robinson, 25, of Charlotte, N.C., was killed last October while vacationing in Mexico with friends.
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie
